issues.description: The StockIngredient 'name' field is exposed with different getter names across artifacts: the template repository defines/get-uses getIngredientName(), while the solution repository defines/get-uses getName(). The problem statement instructs students to "add getters for all the private fields" but does not specify the exact getter name, so students may reasonably expect the conventional getName() signature. This mismatch creates a mapping burden: students comparing template, instructions, and the reference solution will need to reconcile two different identifiers for the same conceptual property (the ingredient's name), and may be confused when searching for or implementing the expected getter or when reading code that invokes it (e.g., findStockIngredient uses different getter names in template vs. solution).
issues.suggested_fix: Standardize the getter name for the StockIngredient name field across template and solution. Prefer the conventional getName() (rename getIngredientName() to getName in the template and update all call sites such as Stock.findStockIngredient to use getName()), or alternatively rename the solution getter to getIngredientName() and update its uses. Using getName() is recommended to match common Java naming conventions and reduce student confusion.
